sect2.title: Anchor Floating Layer or Mask

indexterm.secondary: Anchor the floating layer or mask

sect2.para: If you have created a floating selection, a temporary layer, called a floating layer or floating selection, is added to the layer stack. As long as the floating layer persists, you can only work on that layer.

To work on the rest of the image, you must anchor the floating layer to the former active layer with the Anchor Floating Layer or Mask command; or convert it to a new layer with the To New Layer command. The anchor menu command is only visible if a floating selection is present.

note.para: If there is an active selection tool, the mouse pointer is displayed with an anchor icon when it is outside of the selection.

listitem.para:
From the main menu through
Layer Anchor Floating Layer or Mask .
By using the keyboard shortcut CtrlH.

From the Layers Dialog, you can access it through the Anchor Floating Layer or Mask command of its context menu, or by clicking on the
Anchor Floating Layer or Mask
icon button on the bottom of that dialog.
